title: Liquid
content:
Ask
Liquid
Liquid: The Ultimate Financial Super App.
Liquid Documentation
Who We Are
We‚Äôre a team of technologists, traders, and builders from places like Two Sigma, SIG, D.E. Shaw, and Amazon. Based in New York City, we‚Äôve seen firsthand how archaic and inefficient the financial system is‚Äîfrom slow settlements and hidden fees to clunky user interfaces.
We believe finance should be open, fast, and user-first. That‚Äôs why we built Liquid: a modern financial super app powered by crypto rails.
What Is Liquid?
Liquid is the easiest way to access the core building blocks of modern finance‚Äîall from your phone.
Currently available on iOS and Android (with web versions coming soon), Liquid combines trading, yield, and news into a seamless mobile experience designed for speed, transparency, and power users.
Key Features
Trading
Lowest Fees for Trading Tokens
Execute crypto trades at industry-low fees with deep liquidity and fast execution.
News
Trade What You Read
Curated real-time financial news with embedded one-click trading.
Vaults
Earn 14% APY
Park your idle balances in on-chain vaults that yield up to 14% APY, with a short 4-day lockup.
Audience
50% Revenue Share
Invite friends and earn up to 50% of the revenue they generate. Build your own financial audience.
Next
Trading
Last updated 1 day ago

title: Trading
content:
Ask
Trading
Liquid offers many fun products to trade, like gold and crypto. This section explains the full extent of trading on Liquid.
Spot Trading
Liquid offers spot trading through the search bar. 
On Liquid, you can purchase assets like Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and the HYPE token, for no fees! In the United States, Liquid is by far the lowest-fee solution for purchasing Bitcoin. 
Trading with Multipliers
Liquid's signature feature is letting you trade with multipliers. If you want to buy $100,000 of Bitcoin, you need $100,000 (and potentially thousands more to pay fees). However, on Liquid, you can buy exposure to $100,000 of Bitcoin with a mere $2,500 and a 40x multiplier. You can risk less to earn more! 
Previous
Liquid
Next
Fees
Last updated 3 months ago

title: Fees
content:
Ask
Fees
In order to support the development of the app, Liquid charges fees to users. 
Hyperliquid
On spot assets, where you buy the underlying assets, Liquid charges no additional fees, i.e., it charges exactly what Hyperliquid charges. 
On perpetual futures, which represent directional exposure to the underlying assets, Liquid applies uniform 5 bps fees to both opening and closing trades through builder fees. 
What to know about Liquid fees:
Fees are based on your account‚Äôs rolling 14 day trading volume.
Fees are assessed at the end of each day (UTC).
Maker rebates are paid out continuously on each trade directly to your wallet.
Liquid uses separate fee schedules for perps and spot trading.
Perps and spot volume are counted together to determine your fee tier.
Spot volume counts double toward your fee tier:
(14 day perps volume) + 2 * (14 day spot volume) = (14 day weighted volume)
For the sake of completeness, we show the full fee calculation here.

Ostium
On Ostium assets, fees are charged only when entering a position, unlike in Hyperliquid where they are charged when exiting a position as well. Thus, 10 bps of taker fees on Ostium is equivalent to 5 bps of taker fees on Hyperliquid, excluding liquidations. 
Ostium's fees on entry / exit are: 
Crypto: 
Maker / Taker: 3bps / 10bps
On Ostium, maker fees apply only if the leverage is at most 20x and if the trade reduces the OI imbalance. Otherwise, taker fees apply. 
Indices
All trades are taker; and the fees are 5 bps. 
FX
All trades are taker, the fees are 3 bps except for USD/MXN, which is 5 bps. 
Stocks
All trades are taker, the fees are 5 bps. 
Commodities
All trades are taker, and the fees vary by asset:
Pair Name
Taker fees
XAU / USD
3 bps
CL / USD
10 bps
HG / USD
15 bps
XAG / USD
15 bps
XPT / USD
20 bps
XPD / USD
20 bps
On all Ostium trades, Liquid takes an additional 5 bps.

title: TP / SL
content:
Ask
TP / SL
Manage your risk with Take Profits and Stop Losses
Take Profits are price levels at which you take profit, and Stop Losses are price levels at which you sell to avoid losing more of your capital. In general, we strongly recommend setting stop losses to protect your capital. Cryptocurrency is volatile and trading with multipliers makes them especially volatile. 
There are three ways to set take profit levels and stop losses: two places in the order form, and one place on the positions screen. 
Order Form (Numerical)
Under the advanced tab of the order form, there is a place to set take profits and stop losses. Instead of a mental calculation, you can also calculate the take profit and stop loss based on the return on equity target.
 Order Form (Visual)
After selecting the TP / SL on the order form, you can further refine your selection by looking at a visual interface.
 Position Screen (Visual)
Finally, you can also modify the Take Profit and Stop Loss after the trade by clicking on the 
 Previous
Fees

TWAP
Last updated 3 months ago

title: TWAP
content:
Ask
TWAP
Minimize price slippage with TWAP orders on Liquid.
TWAP (Time-Weighted Average Price) lets you execute large trades over time by splitting them into smaller chunks and sending them at regular intervals. This reduces market impact and helps you get a better average price.
Why use TWAP on Liquid?
Low fees
Liquid offers some of the lowest taker fees in the market.
Smart execution
Orders can be randomized in time to prevent front-running and execution manipulation.
Smoother fills
Avoid large, sudden trades that can move the market against you.
What is Slippage?
Slippage is the difference between the price you intended to trade at and the price you actually get.
TWAP helps minimize slippage by spreading your order over time and reducing price impact.

title: Points
content:
Ask
Points
A brief description of how Liquid rewards early contributors to the platform
Liquid points are distributed at the end of each season. Each user is awarded points in proportion to their contribution, according to a proprietary formula. The schedule is as follows:
Season 0 (May 1st to November 3rd): 600k points
Season 0.5 (November 3rd ‚Äî November 17th): 200k points
Season 1 (Starting November 18th):
Week 1 (November 18th ‚Äî November 24th): 100k points
Every week thereafter: (100k points)

News Feed
Last updated 1 day ago

title: News Feed
content:
Ask
News Feed
Liquid turns the latest social media news into actionable trading decisions with a swipe-to-trade newsfeed inside every account. Traders can react to news items with left or right swipes that register as bearish or bullish biases, and the app will prompt you to express that bias in the market via opening a new trade.
In this section, learn more about: 
Customizing the news feed.
Trading from the news feed.
Previous
Points
Next
Custom Feeds
Last updated 3 months ago

title: Custom Feeds
content:
Ask
Custom Feeds
Tap the page icon üìÉ at the bottom navigation bar.
Inside the feed, each content card shows real-time counts of other Liquid users who have previously reacted bearishly or bullishly to the news you are reading. Scroll endlessly to see as many social news items as you want.
To curate your news feed, tap the filter icon ‚ñº in the top right corner of the app.
From the menu that appears, choose the content you want to populate your feed to focus on exactly the news accounts you care about. Liquid will remember your preferences. 
Previous
News Feed
Next
News Trading
Last updated 3 months ago

title: News Trading
content:
Ask
News Trading
Liquid provides a gesture-heavy news feed you can trade from while scrolling. Each content card offers two different actions to tap into a new trade depending on your swiping and tapping preferences. 
While scrolling the feed, notice each card carries tallies of Bullish and Bearish votes. These are sourced from Liquid users who voted prior to you opening the newsfeed. If you agree, tap the Bullish or Bearish button to contribute your vote. If you want to express your bias as a trade, tap the Trade button that appears below the news card you voted on.
The app will redirect you to the order screen to enter the direction, amount, multiplier, and other details of your trade.
If you are reading the news feed but not considering votes by other users, simply swipe the news card to the left (bearish) or right (bullish) to express your bias.
To express your bias as a trade, tap the Trade button that appears below the news card you swiped.

Vaults
Last updated 3 months ago

title: Vaults
content:
Ask
Vaults
The highest-yielding, nearly risk free, source of income.
HLP Vault
The HLP Vault is a yield-bearing product that lets users earn high interest on their crypto deposits by participating in Hyperliquid‚Äôs native liquidity provisioning strategy.
How It Works
When you deposit into the HLP Vault, your funds are allocated to the Hyperliquid Liquidity Provider (HLP) strategy. This strategy operates natively on the Hyperliquid exchange, where it benefits from privileged access to liquidation flow and order book data. This edge allows HLP to run sophisticated market-making algorithms that have historically delivered strong, consistent returns.
Thanks to this performance, the HLP Vault is currently offering yields around 10% APY, though rates may vary with market conditions.
4-Day Lockup
To ensure system integrity and prevent abuse:
Each deposit triggers a 4-day lockup period during which withdrawals are disabled.
Subsequent deposits reset the cooldown, meaning the timer restarts from your most recent deposit.
This design helps maintain strategy stability and prevents spam on the backend.

title: Referral Bonuses
content:
Ask
Referral Bonuses
Every Liquid user is eligible to earn referral bonuses when their friends create an account using your referral code and start trading. The Referrals tab is your personal hub for monitoring the passive revenue you earn by inviting anyone in your social circles to try Liquid.
Turn your network of crypto traders into real income and receive up to 50% of the fees on their trades automatically. The more friends who join Liquid using your referral code, the more you earn.

title: Rewards Hub
content:
Ask
Rewards Hub
Open the Referrals Hub by tapping the gift icon üéÅ on the bottom navigation bar.
Inside the referrals window, you‚Äôll immediately find your lifetime rewards, any unclaimed bonuses, and the invite tools you‚Äôll need, including:
Claimed referral rewards
Unclaimed referral rewards
Number of friends referred
Your referral code
Referrals information
All the earnings and referral stats shown in this window refresh automatically. Track them whenever you open Liquid on your mobile device.

Last updated 3 months ago

title: Refer Traders
content:
Ask
Refer Traders
Invite your friends to try Liquid with the code inside your referrals hub or by generating a link that points to your code.
To share a link, open the referrals hub and tap the ‚ÄúInvite a friend‚Äù button.
A link is generated that you can send directly through SMS, Telegram, WhatsApp, or other messaging apps. Or you can copy the link and navigate to whatever app you choose to paste and send it to a friend.
To share your unique referral code, find the 8-digit alphanumeric string (e.g., ‚ÄúABCD3FG1‚Äù) at the middle of the screen. Tap the ‚ÄúCopy‚Äù button next to it. 
Paste it in Telegram, Discord, or wherever your friend is waiting.
An invited trader will enter your code when prompted by the app as they create a new Liquid account. 
When they start trading on the app, your referral bonus balance will update.

title: Claim Rewards
content:
Ask
Claim Rewards
Rewards for referring traders can be claimed at any time.
Tap the gift icon üéÅ to open the referrals hub. 
Then press the large Claim Rewards button near the middle of the screen. 
After claiming, funds denominated in USDC will deposit to your Liquid account address.
The Claim Rewards button remains greyed out until the unclaimed rewards balance rises above $0.00.

title: Troubleshooting
content:
Ask
Troubleshooting
If you‚Äôre experiencing issues with inviting friends, claiming rewards, or any other referral tasks, we‚Äôre here to resolve them for you.
Tap the home icon üè† on the left of the bottom navigation bar.
At the top right of the hope screen, press ‚ÄúText Us!‚Äù
Your messaging app will open with our support number auto-filled in the text recipient field. Text us: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm having problems with my referrals.‚Äù Our team will respond ASAP.

FAQ
Last updated 3 months ago

title: FAQ
content:
Ask
FAQ
Frequently Asked Questions
How is Liquid different from a Centralized Exchange? (e.g. Robinhood, Coinbase) 
Liquid is non-custodial, meaning we never hold your funds or personal data. You trade directly from your own wallet, and your assets remain in your control at all times. This is fundamentally different from centralized exchanges like Robinhood or Coinbase, which take custody of your assets and personal information.
Key Differences
You control your assets.
With Liquid, funds are stored in your wallet‚Äînot ours. There‚Äôs no single point of failure or risk of your funds being frozen, seized, or misused.
No KYC honeypots.
Centralized exchanges store massive amounts of sensitive identity data (e.g. passports, selfies, SSNs). If that data is hacked‚Äîas has happened with platforms like Coinbase‚Äîyou‚Äôre exposed. Liquid doesn‚Äôt require KYC to trade, so there‚Äôs nothing to leak.
Censorship-resistant.
On Liquid, no one can freeze your account or block your trades. Everything is executed on-chain, permissionlessly.
No custodial blowups.
With a CEX, you‚Äôre trusting them not to go bankrupt, halt withdrawals, or run fractional reserves. With Liquid, there‚Äôs no trust required.
